summary:
Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
Reaffirms its commitment to Côte d’Ivoire's sovereignty, independence, territorial integrity, and unity.
Supports the Linas-Marcoussis Agreement and the efforts of ECOWAS and France to promote a peaceful settlement.
Establishes a UN Mission in Côte d’Ivoire (MINUCI) for six months to facilitate implementation of the Linas-Marcoussis Agreement.
Approves a military liaison group to advise on military matters, monitor the situation, and establish liaison with French and ECOWAS forces.
The group will comprise 26 military officers, with up to 50 additional officers deployable as needed.
Requests attention to the gender component within MINUCI and the situation of women and girls.
Urges Ivorian political forces to implement the Linas-Marcoussis Agreement without delay and develop a timetable for implementation.
Recalls the importance of enabling the Government of National Reconciliation to exercise its mandate during the transitional period.
